headline_content: Your best friend is ALIVE AND WELL
text_content: You kept her focused when the panic set in. She followed your advice, made it to the sewer, and crossed the northern border. She is currently located in a refugee camp upstate, shaken but unharmed. She asks about you every day.

headline_content: Your best friend is ALIVE, BUT TRAUMATIZED
text_content: She made it out physically, but the fear took its toll. She is safe in a shelter, yet she refuses to sleep or eat. She is convinced the rescue is just another trap.
She sheltered in a supply closet, waiting for the situation to stabilize. The building was overrun before rescue teams could reach the campus. Maybe she should have run.
She boarded the 'Rescue Transport' bus. Tracking data indicates the vehicle bypassed the safe zone and moved on. The signal was lost shortly after.

headline_content: Your mom is ALIVE AND WELL
text_content: You gave her the strength to make the impossible choice. She left your father behind and descended into the drains just as the fire started to spread. She navigated the tunnels in the dark and emerged three miles past the blockade, alive. All thanks to you.

headline_content: Your mom is ALIVE, BUT TRAUMATIZED
text_content: She escaped the city, but not the fright. She flinches at every shadow and scans every room for hidden dangers. You saved her life, but at what cost?
She went to the pharmacy to get flu medication for your dad. A violent riot broke out inside the store over supplies. She was lost in the chaos and never returned home.
She evacuated to the Stadium, following the official instructions for rescue. The facility was sealed for 'Containment Protocols' shortly after she arrived. No evacuees were released

headline_content: Your partner is ALIVE AND WELL
text_content: He left everything behind and went underground. The military bombed his building moments later, but he was already gone. He washed up in the riverbed outside the perimeter - dirty, shaken, but alive.

headline_content: Your partner is ALIVE, BUT TRAUMATIZED
text_content: He survived, but he learned your lessons too well. He trusts no one now - not the rescuers, not the doctors. He sits in his room with a weapon, waiting for a threat that isn't there.
He remained in his apartment to wait out the crisis. The military designated his sector as 'Compromised' on the final morning. The building was destroyed by an airstrike at dawn.
